title.narrative: Institution Building and Financial Management Training in Peru

description.narrative: Celebrate the anniversary of Eclof Peru internally., Provide time for employees to attend pastoral care meetings in communities., Evaluate submissions of business plan., Provide health education and disease prevention training to clients., Train clients in business management., Approve business plan and loans., Train and support women community leaders to facilitate community-identified educational training., Client recommendation to Eclof Development Managers., Identify women community leaders who will conduct outreach and program Eclof financial and nonfinancial services., Promotion activities in new zones coordinated by women community leaders and facilitated by Eclof Development Managers., Hire disabled people and determine the zones where they will be best suited to work.,Liaise with Lima Universities and gauge their willingness to provide courses and/or programs that support people with disabilities. Network with CONADIS (local government agency representing disabled people) to ensure their awareness and support of the project.

The program aims to improve the living conditions of disadvantaged children, youth, women and men in urban, rural and suburban areas. ECLOF Peru is strategically promoting financial education and management training with the goal of strengthening decision-making in savings, avoidance of debt to other financial institutions, standardization of training modules and business plans for increased productivity and accelerated growth of microenterprises. Training is not limited to financial topics and in fact includes education on such topics as gender-based violence, agrobusiness, family dynamics, health and hygiene and personal development. In 2016, Eclof Peru will add a vulnerable population to its target clients: people with disabilities. The government has mandated that companies with over 50 employees hire a percentage of people with disabilities. However recent studies are showing that there have been limitations to their entering the job force. Eclof will target people with disabilities and provide them with training in a wide variety of areas. Aligning with its 2015-2017 business plan, Eclof Peru in 2016 will develop new products, increase and continue training in rural areas, improve institutional visibility and market presence, and address infrastructure/personnel training needs in the central office. Restructuring of the organization occurred throughout 2014 with Episcopal Relief & Development support and the process will conclude in 2015 leading to increased operational efficiency of Eclof Peru and better support of clients.
